alert.note: Alert for City of Chesapeake; City of Norfolk; City of Portsmouth; City of Suffolk (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 24 at 7:27AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Virginia, including the following independent cities, City of Chesapeake, City of Norfolk, City of Portsmouth and City of Suffolk. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 727 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Virginia Beach, Old Dominion University, Downtown Portsmouth, Downtown Norfolk, Churchland, Norfolk State University, Ocean View, Norfolk, Chesapeake, Portsmouth, Suffolk, Ghent, Norfolk NAS, Cradock, Norview, Western Branch, Wards Corner, South Norfolk, Huntersville and Willoughby Spit. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: City of Chesapeake; City of Norfolk; City of Portsmouth; City of Suffolk
